comment: I did hate taking her class most of the time, but I attribute that to the contents aren't for me and not her. She was actually decent at teaching this class. Attendance is mandatory, but you're usually able to leave early. The group project is something to be expected in this class in general so, keep that in mind. Otherwise, wasn't very hard.

A strict grader, doesn't give 2nd chances unless you submit through email a few minutes after it closes. Once it's closed, it WON'T reopen. If you take her class, download EVERYTHING to pass. Group projects and attendance are MANDATORY. If you take the class, work with good work ethic people. Class gets harder. DON'T LET IT PILE UP.mybad word limit
she is average, her class is easy to pass. attendance is not required but important bc almost everything is group work. she teaches mostly out of a online free textbook

She is a nice professor but the way she organized her online classroom and the vague instructions of her assignments were frustrating. Mrs.Shinall is also delayed on responding to her emails. The instructions for the major group project were vague and unclear. My group did not understand some of the instructions on the assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Easy class overall. No lockdown browser for quizzes. No exams, just quizzes, discussions, & several projects (some individual, some group). You will be with the same group for your projects for most of the semester. If you have a good group the projects are pretty simple and straightforward. Quizzes are based off the online readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Easy class, very sweet professor. Material is easy, just do your work and you will get a good grade. She requires attendance which I don't love since half the work you do in class is your assignments for the week, but besides that she was very easy and would recommend her to anyone. Make sure you get a good group for the final project.

Do yourself a favor and avoid this professor. She teaches technical writing and does not even do it herself. She gives out huge projects and does not give due dates or any instructions. Her emails are unprofessional and unhelpful if she responds and the actual format of the class makes me wonder why she's teaching this course.
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Absolutely one of the worst professors I have ever had. I got stuck in a horrible group (they don't work) for two major assignments (half the semester) that equal 40% of my final grade. My 3.9 GPA is going to drop like a rock because of her complete lack of leadership. I have been in online classes for years and she is not responsive at all. AWFUL!

She is the worst technical writer ever. Quizzes are filled with trick questions, her instructions for our major group projects were never clear, and due dates were all over the place. You better pray for a good group because these projects are difficult to try to do in an online format. Save yourself some stress choose someone else.

One of the easiest classes I've ever taken, it was just sort of tedious and annoying. The major grades were all a part of a group project and there was no final, just the turning in of the project. I had a pretty good group, but I imagine if you get stuck with a bad one this class will be absolutely horrible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took this as a summer class ive taken many summer classes this was by far the stupidest and most confusing, all group projects and she grades as if were all english majors. do NOT recommend

The usual class. The content is pretty boring, but useful. One group project that has multiple parts to it that is pretty straight forward. Also there are quizzes based on what we read for the week. Not too bad.
Take her if you can for tcom 2010 it was the easiest class ever. You have weekly quizzes that are based on the textbook (free) and group projects but it's not too difficult.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall, professor Shinall was very helpful. She is open-minded and available for any questions. The upside of the TCOM2010 course is: No tests. Instead it consists of quizzes, little projects, and group papers. A rubric is provided. Free textbook on d2l which is not heavy on the reading.

Great professor for TCOM 2010! She WANTS her students to succeed and offers guidance if you have questions. Grades are based off of attendance, projects (are not scary she is so so so helpful), and quizzes (from the book). She always offers to look over projects before you turn them in! If you want a caring, helpful, and kind professor take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Cheryl was a really easy teacher for TCOM 2010. I took her online class, and recommend it. I hate writing, and these types of classes in general, but this one wasn't too time consuming. Easy A if you do the work.

Great professor. In order to get an A in this class, you MUST follow instructions. If you step outside the rubric, you will lose a lot of points. The are few quizzes (low weight) and no tests. Writing projects are 80% of your grade. She offers to proofread your projects before turning them in. Take her up on the offer and you can't go wrong.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: She wants you to think she's a thorough grader, but you'll catch on soon enough that she puts little to no effort in her grading process. Easy class though.

TCOM is a weird English class as it is because it's focus is on formatting. But what Shinall requires on some of these assignments is bizarre. In the hybrid class, the lectures don't help at all. Discussion posts are where most of the learning happens because you're forced to read. The class isn't that hard, but everything feels like busy work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: (Hybrid) 10 discussion posts each week (1 where you respond to that week's question, 9 others where you respond to other people's posts), 1 group project, 3 reports, and 1 final project (individual -- written formal proposal and PPT). Get your paper checked by her before you turn it in and ask questions! Very format-oriented. Lots of printing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This was the hardest easy A class I've ever taken. Make sure to follow the format she gives EXACTLY as she gives it. Dont make any grammatical errors on the papers because she takes off points for that.  Her grading is very weird, be sure to get your papers reviewed by her before you turn them in & that will help a lot.

If you're looking for a teacher that grades on content she is not the one. She will Mark you off 10 or more points just for format only. It does not matter if you wrote with passion and wrote a wonderful paper, if the format of the paper is off in any way your paper will go from A to a low B or C. DO NOT RECOMMEND. My Writing didn't improve at all
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took her in the summer. Her class is very straightforward and if you do what she asks, then you should be able to get an A or B. She teaches like a high school teacher. All the busy work is done in class with a partner  and the major assignments are the homework which is individual.

just do your work. she tells you exactly what she wants. you do weekly discussion post and typed assignments. final assignment is long and time consuming but its easy at the same time. Almost impossible not to get an A or B.
Prof. Shinall really wants you to succeed. The class consists of a lot of busy work, however, she is one of the nicest professors that you will ever meet.

Yes, she does teach like a highschool teacher. You will have quite a bit of classwork, homework and participation activities, so always show up to class. Get the book because you will use it nearly every class.

Nothing was put on D2L and she teaches more in the style of a HS teacher but she teaches really well, has tremendous background experience and is super nice so it worked. Really takes the time for one on one help and she made templates for all the major assignments. Attendance is mandatory but class doesn't extend the full amount of time generally.
She makes business communication harder than it really is. Your papers have to be perfect. Addentence is mandatory and lectures are dry. Take another teacher for business communication if possible.

She is a very responsible professor and you can not be lazy in her class. If you skip one class, she will need to talk to you after class. The good thing is,you can always bring your paper to her in advance and ask she to revise it. If you do everything as she said, your grade is definitely A!

She is very patronizing. This is the class where form takes precedence over content. Format it exactly as she has told you to. You may make a 95 or a 100... or 85 depending on her mood. The book is the cure for insomnia, good luck reading it. Very mediocre teacher. Try taking someone else like Schmidt for TCOM.

She talks to you like your in high school, which could be insulting, but if you pay attention to what she has to deal with you will understand why. This is a class of format, so follow directions and an A should be no problem. Not a bad class for what it is.

This class was very easy, and I had difficulty writing papers short enough to meet the maximum length. My class was scifi themed, and in addition to scifi readings, we also watched Star Wars and episodes of The Twilight Zone and Star Trek. The "rubrics" for papers are somewhat vague and don't really tell you what you're supposed to write about.

A great teacher. Majority of your grade is based on five papers. she gives you  instructions on how to write the papers. Follow instructions you would do well on the papers. She has test that are okay so you need to read the book. However the tests only count for 10 to 15% of the overall grade.
great teacher. just show up for class write the five essays, and an easy A. she is very clear, and all your papers are about topics that you choose

She is helpful in class, but do not expect to receive any help via email or office hours.  Tests are hard, but only count for 10% of total grade.  Writing assignments are bulk of grade and as long as you follow her instructions completely, you should do fine.  Book is mostly for tests, otherwise it is mostly useless.

She taught me English while doing this course.  Our familiarity made things a bit easier for me.  She is a very approachable person, always happy it seems =) & willing to listen.  Ask questions if needs be, voice your opinions POLITELY. No textbooks...  Another A+ speaking =) I definitely recommend her for English and hitchhikers guide

Lovely professor, very polite and respectful. Her approach to English was not a forceful one.  Textbooks were rarely used - for mini class exercises, save cash and rent. Just 5 essays for the semester, a portfolio, and attend class and the peer workshops... they actually help a bit... A+ speaking =) and someone with a changed attitude about English

Not too bad of a class. About 5 writing assignments that as long as you do them like she says you'll make a good grade. There were only 4 or 5 ch. test which only count for less than 10% of your grade, so your writing assignments are the majority of your grade.
She is okay, some times she seems very understanding and some times she seems a little insensitive. She is very strict on how she grades your papers and she never checks her emails.
Very friendly and organized professor. Easy to follow instructions that are in writing. Attendance mandatory to stay with changing schedule.
She is so mean and so lazy. Her teaching style is old and awkward. If you want good education and good grade don't take her.
She's very nice and very helpful. Her class is easy and very laid back. If you want to take hitchhikers, take it with her. She's a great lady
Very Easy, Gives a Quiz every day that is completed in groups. The test comes straight from these Quizzes. Very easy not too many writing assignments.
She was awesome.  Really easy class.  Do your work and show up for class.  You'll enjoy this professor!
very nice and helpful.. always willing to let you out of class early. graded easily. always smiling.

I got a B on my first 3 papers. I got an A on the last one , and my last one was horribly written, i simply checked my grammer better. You can write some horrible **** and she doesnt care, you will get an A on it, as long as you dont have many grammer errors. Overall this class was easier than any english class i ever took i highschool.
She was a good teacher, she was easy, but she did a good job.
She is a sweet and understanding lady. All you have to do is come to class and turn in your essays. Make sure you attend the peer editing sessions and you should recieve and A or B.
Very Easy! just do the essays, show up for peer editing. Easy teacher.

From the book.  Her lectures are reading the outline from the text.  Her tests are easy, keep the chapter quizes.  The test questions are cut and paste from the quizes.  Writing assignments are not too dificult if you try.  I knew some students that didn't even turn in all assignments.
No Comments
